snippet: Mr. Brady, the White House press secretary who was wounded in an assassination attempt on President Ronald Reagan, championed tighter regulations from his wheelchair.
abstract: James S Brady, White House press secretary who was wounded in an assassination attempt on President Ronald Reagan in 1981 and then became a symbol of the fight for gun control, championing tighter regulations from his wheelchair, dies at age 73.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Brady, the White House press secretary who was wounded in an assassination attempt on President Ronald Reagan, championed tighter regulations from his wheelchair.

headline.main: Taking a Bullet, Gaining a Cause: James S. Brady Dies at 73
headline.print_headline: James S. Brady, 73, Dies; Press Secretary Took a Bullet and Gained a Cause

keywords.value: Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence
keywords.name: organizations
